III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Bethany Christian Services Bellaview program is located on 52nd street just south east
of Grand Rapids Michigan. The facility is a two story single family home with a walk out
lower level. The home is situated on a large lot set back about 100 yards from the road
surrounded by woods. Currently the home is under construction and renovation. There
is a two story addition being built off the back of the home that will eventually be the
bedroom wing and storage area. The lower walkout level is currently being remodeled
to provide a private apartment living unit for the housing parents and some additional
recreation space for the youth in program. The main level of the home consists of a
living room, family room, kitchen, dining, full bathroom and a 128 square foot bedroom
that will accomodate two youth. The upper level consists of three additional offices and
a full bathroom that will be used for staff, and therapy offices.
Alarm system has been installed throughout the home to provide for added supervision.
The staffing will be 24/7 up and awake staff.
2

An environmental health inspection was completed on 06/06/14 and the facility received
an “A” rating. A follow up fire inspection was completed on 08/21/14 giving the facility
approval with an “A” rating to occupy the facility with the two residents while the facility
is still under construction. Once the construction is complete the facility will be able to
function with 6 residents. The estimated time for completion of the addition and lower
level remodel is September 30, 2014.
B. Program Description
Bellaview program is a long term community based program for 14-17 year old female
unaccompanied alien children who are working towards obtaining legal status in the
United States. This population will be primarily Spanish speaking; therefore the staff
are fluent in both Spanish and English.
Bellaview is a step down program for youth who have experienced trauma, abuse and
dangerous situations through their journey into the United States. These particular
youth have had previous stays in a shelter, secure facilities, and/or staff secure
facilities. These youth will be learning independence in a trauma informed environment.
They will attend public school through the Kentwood Intermediate School District, and
attend school full time at E. Kentwood High School.
Bellaview is currently contracted through United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
and is working to obtain a contract through the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR)
here in Michigan.
Bellaview is staffed to provide weekly intensive integration and therapeutic services to
help these children adjust to living independently in a foreign county. Bellaview uses a
house parent model in alignment with the teaching family model. These youth will
experience a family style living unit as well as a structure and programmatic routine that
is consistent with what is seen in a Residential setting.

none
